key_title: Key to the species of Swainsona

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the subfamilies of Fabaceae
Key to the genera of Fabaceae subfam. Faboideae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems glabrous or hairy; hairs basifixed or laterally attached at base
Stems hairy; hairs symmetrically or asymmetrically medifixed
Stems glabrous or sparsely hairy
Stems moderately to densely hairy
Stipules leaf-like, broad-ovate, often obliquely so, mostly more than 5 mm wide, 4–15 mm long; flowers yellow
Stipules triangular to triangular-acuminate, mostly less than 5 mm wide, 1–10 mm long; flowers not yellow
Apices of leaflets narrow and long-tapering
Apices of leaflets obtuse, retuse or emarginate, if acute then not long-tapering
Flowers 8–20 mm long (very rarely shorter); stipules 2–15 mm long
Flowers 5–10 mm long; stipules 1–5 mm long
Keel apex obtuse and obscurely lipped; stipules 2–5 mm long
Keel apex strongly upcurved, recurved or coiled; stipules 2–15 mm long
Keel apex strongly upcurved; style less than 10 mm long, tip straight
Keel apex strongly recurved or coiled; style more than 10 mm long, tip curved
Stem-hairs sparse, minute and appressed or absent; keel usually twisted in a complete circle, tip yellow
Stem-hairs dense or sparse, c. 0.5 mm long, curved or spreading; keel usually twisted in an incomplete circle, tip blue
Leaves mostly with 21–41 leaflets; leaflets broad-cuneate to orbicular, 1–5 mm long
Leaves with 3–23 leaflets; leaflets narrow-elliptic to (ob)ovate, 1–20 mm long
Stems glabrous or with tubercles bearing minute hairs; leaflets 1–4 mm wide; pods on stipe 2–3 mm long
Stems densely or sparsely pubescent, not tuberculate; leaflets 3–10 mm wide; pods on stipe less than 2 mm long
Stem-hairs spreading, antrorsely divergent or curved
Stem-hairs mostly appressed, ends sometimes raised
Leaves with 21–41 leaflets; leaflets broad-cuneate to orbicular, 1–5 mm long
Leaves with 5–25 leaflets; leaflets obovate to elliptic or narrow-lanceolate, mostly 5–40 mm long
Stem-hairs spreading or antrorsely curved; keel apex conspicuously twisted
Stem-hairs spreading or antrorsely divergent; keel apex not conspicuously twisted
Erect shrub to 2 m tall; leaflets 15–25; flowers 20–25 mm long; bracts 5–10 mm long; calyx with white-woolly pubescence
Prostrate or ascending herbs to 15 cm tall; leaflets 5–15; flowers 5–10 mm long; bracts 1–4 mm long; calyx pubescence not white-woolly
Leaflets mostly opposite, the terminal longer than laterals; stipules usually forming an abaxial ridge; calyx hairs mostly dark brown to black; keel apex twisted; upper part of style not wing-like
Leaflets often all irregular; stipules not usually forming an abaxial ridge; calyx hairs dark, light or mixed; keel apex barely twisted; upper part of style winglike
Leaflets narrow-elliptic to elliptic, 2–10 mm wide; flowers predominantly purple; coastal plants
Leaflets cuneate to suborbicular, 1–5 mm wide; flowers predominantly purple, pink or white; inland plants
Leaflets with a circular, yellow apical gland
Leaflets lacking an apical gland
Flowers predominantly orange and yellow; stipules 3-lobed, the central lobe longest
Flowers predominantly purple or pink; stipules entire
Stem-hairs mostly to 0.5 mm long
Stem-hairs at least 0.5 mm long
Leaflets narrowly acute with recurved point; racemes mostly 3–11-flowered; base of calyx spirally twisted
Leaflets acute or subacute to emarginate, sometimes mucronate; racemes mostly 3–25-flowered; base of calyx not spirally twisted
Leaflets 13–21; keel apex not twisted; widespread coastal plant
Leaflets 3–11 per leaf; keel apex often twisted; rare plant of the north-west
Style tip straight; flowers mostly 10–15 mm long (base of calyx to tip of keel); keel longer than wings
Style tip geniculate; flowers mostly 7–11 mm long (base of calyx to tip of keel); keel about as long as wings
